intro: Scabiosa triniifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features trifoliate leaves, which are divided into three leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa triniifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
